list.title: Ammo
list.description: Create a new ammo pickup entity.

list.title: Ammo#bounding
list.description: bounding - the entity's bounding behavior.

list.title: Ammo#bounds
list.description: bounds - the entity's bounds for intersection.

list.title: Ammo#color
list.description: color - background glow color for the entity's render image.

list.title: Ammo#distance
list.description: distance - the distance between the player and the entity to trigger behavior.

list.title: Ammo#glow
list.description: glow - background glow for the entity's render image.

list.title: Ammo#image
list.description: image - the entity's render image.

list.title: Ammo#item
list.description: item - the entity item.

list.title: Ammo#markToDelete
list.description: markToDelete - determines whether the entity should be removed from the game.

list.title: Ammo#pickup
list.description: Defines the behaviour to triggger when the player intersects with the entity.When the player intersects with the entity, the "reload" audio snippet willplay through the AudioFX handler, the player's ammo or magazines will bereplenished through the Ballistics handler, and then the entity will bemarked for deletion, upon which it wil be removed from the canvas on the nextframe/repaint.

list.title: Ammo#render
list.description: Render the ammo pickup entity on the canvas.This is called every frame/repaint to render the entity. Note that this isa statically-placed entity, therefore the x,y coordinates will not change onupdate.

list.title: Ammo#sleep
list.description: sleep - the entity's render state.

list.title: Ammo#type
list.description: type - the type of entity.

list.title: Ammo#update
list.description: Update the ammo pickup entity on each frame for rendering, collision and behaviour.This is called every frame/repaint, upon which collision vectors are calculated todetermine if the player and the entity intersect, if they do, then the entity's pickupmethod is executed as a callback.

list.title: Ammo#value
list.description: value - the entity's in-game value.

list.title: Ammo#x
list.description: x - the entity's x coordinate.

list.title: Ammo#y
list.description: y - the entity's y coordinate.

list.description: Clean up handled projectiles.

list.title: Ballistics#refillWeaponAmmoClip
list.description: Refill the curren ammo clip or replenish magazines.

list.title: Ballistics#registerProjectiles
list.description: Register bullet projectiles for rendering and collision.

list.title: Ballistics#render
list.description: Render projectiles.

list.title: Ballistics#setEquippedWeaponDisplayInformation
list.description: Set equippred weapon display information e.g. ammo, magazines.

list.title: Ballistics#shouldReloadWeaponAmmoClip
list.description: Determine if weapon needs to be reloaded and handle accordingly.

list.title: Ballistics#update
list.description: Updae ballistics data, handle weapon fires and cleanup.

list.title: Bullet
list.description: Create new bullet projectile.

list.title: Bullet#render
list.description: Render the bullet projectile on the canvas.

list.title: Bullet#update
list.description: Update the projectile data for bounds tracking, collision and cleanup.

list.title: Camera
list.description: Create new camera.

list.title: Camera#newScene
list.description: Clear the rendering context to prepare for a new scene.

list.title: Camera#postRender
list.description: Restore the rendering context state after rendering.

list.title: Camera#preRender
list.description: Adjust the camera's position based on the passed entity's position.

list.title: Camera#update
list.description: Update the camera and rendering state for entities

list.title: Collision.arcBoxCollision
list.description: Caclulate collision beween entity (arc) and wall (box).This method is a specialized function designed for detecting collisions betweenan arc-shaped entity (potentially representing the player) and a rectangularbox-shaped entity (potentially representing a wall) on the canvas.

list.title: Collision.distance
list.description: Determine distance between two vectors or two entities with vectors.This method calculates the Euclidean distance between two points.It's versatile, accepting either entity objects or numerical valuesas parameters. When `vectors` is set to `true`, the method considersthe parameters as vector components, determining the distance betweenthe points they represent.

list.title: Collision.entityToPlayer
list.description: Player-to-entity collision.

list.title: Collision.entityToWalls
list.description: Detect and handle collision between entities and walls.

list.title: Collision.intersection
list.description: Determine whether or not two entities intersect on the canvas.This method is a basic collision check that determines if two entities,defined by their rectangular properties (x, y, width, height), intersect.The logic is straightforward: if any side of one entity is positioned to theleft, right, above, or below the other, they do not intersect. Otherwise,they overlap, triggering a collision.

list.title: Enemy
list.description: Create a new enemy entity.

list.title: Enemy#hitByProjectile
list.description: Set the enemy velocity and handle DPS when enemies are hit by projectiles.

list.title: Enemy#pushAlong
list.description: Set the push velocity to push enemies when bumped by entities.

list.title: Enemy#render
list.description: Render the enemy entity on the canvas.

list.title: Enemy#update
list.description: Update the enemy entity for rendering, collision and behaviour.

list.title: Health#markToDelete
list.description: markToDelete - determines whether the entity should be removed from the game.

list.title: Health#pickup
list.description: Defines the behaviour when health entity is picked up.When the player intersects with the entity, the "inject" audio snippet willplay through the AudioFX handler, the player's health will be replenished bythe entity value or they will gain a medkit if their health is full, and thenthe entity will be marked for deletion, upon which it wil be removed from thecanvas on the next frame/repaint.

list.title: Health#render
list.description: Render the health pickup entity on the canvas.This is called every frame/repaint to render the entity. Note that this isa statically-placed entity, therefore the x,y coordinates will not change onupdate.

list.title: Health#sleep
list.description: sleep - the entity's render state.

list.title: Health#type
list.description: type - the type of entity.

list.title: Health#update
list.description: Update the health pickup entity for rendering, collision and behaviour.This is called every frame/repaint, upon which collision vectors are calculated todetermine if the player and the entity intersect, if they do, then the entity's pickupmethod is executed as a callback.

list.title: Health#value
list.description: value - the entity's in-game value.

list.title: Health#x
list.description: x - the entity's x coordinate.

list.title: Health#y
list.description: y - the entity's y coordinate.

list.title: Renderer.render
list.description: Render the entity on the canvas.This method is called on every frame/repaint. It checks to see if the entity render stateis active, and checks the entity type to apply specified behaviour and styles.

list.title: Stamina#pickup
list.description: Defines the behaviour when stamina entity is picked up.When the player intersects with the entity, the "inject" audio snippet willplay through the AudioFX handler, the player's speed will be boosted by theentity value for a set number of seconds, and then the entity will be marked fordeletion, upon which it wil be removed from the canvas on the next frame/repaint.

list.title: Stamina#render
list.description: Render the stamina pickup entity on the canvas.This is called every frame/repaint to render the entity. Note that this isa statically-placed entity, therefore the x,y coordinates will not change onupdate.
